summary: This document is a report generated on August 14, 2019, containing records of posts from an online forum (likely 4chan's /pol/ board) made on August 10, 2019, in response to a subpoena for Case ID 2019R01059. The posts describe an anonymous account from someone claiming to be at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, alleging suspicious circumstances around Jeffrey Epstein's death, including an unrecorded vehicle transfer and a possible switch of inmates.

persons.name: Anonymous
persons.context: The poster on /pol/ who claims to have insider knowledge of events at MCC New York on the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death, describing a transfer and questioning the official suicide narrative.

events.title: Anonymous Posts Alleging Suspicious Activity at MCC
events.description: Multiple anonymous posts on /pol/ board describe events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on the night of August 9-10, 2019, claiming Jeffrey Epstein was taken to medical in a wheelchair, an unrecorded transport van arrived, and he was later found dead in a single cell, with the poster suggesting a possible inmate switch.

events.title: Deletion of Post 222520257
events.description: A post (No. 222520257) on /pol/ was cleared/deleted on August 10, 2019, at 09:46:22 EDT. The report notes the deletion record was cleared as it didn't correspond to a standard deletion.

keyFacts: The document is a report generated from subpoenaed records related to Case ID 2019R01059, capturing online forum posts from August 10, 2019.

An anonymous poster claims to have been at MCC New York and describes Jeffrey Epstein being taken to medical after 4:15 AM, followed by an unrecorded transport van and a man in a green military-style outfit, leading to speculation Epstein was switched out and did not commit suicide.
The posts were made from two IP addresses (107.77.223.177 and 172.58.139.162) on the /pol/ board, with timestamps around 8:00-8:47 AM EDT on August 10, 2019.
One of the key posts (No. 222520257) was later cleared/deleted from the system, with the report noting the deletion record was 'cleared' as non-standard.
The document serves as evidence of early online conspiracy theories and public speculation regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death, captured as part of an official investigation.
